text.*:
Romance languages-speaking countries

The Romance-speaking world,[1][2] romanophone,[3][4] neolatin world,[5] or Latin-speaking world,[6] is the part of the world where Romance languages (those derived from Latin) are either official, co-official, or significantly used, comprising Latin America, Latin Europe, Romance-speaking Africa and Romance-speaking Asia.

It includes the Spanish-, Portuguese-, French-, Italian-, Romanian- and Catalan-speaking communities.

In European countries like this, the 6-continent combined-America model is usually taught.
